util.disjointset

Class OptimalUnionFind

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.disjointset.OptimalUnionFind
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DisjointSet

    public class OptimalUnionFind
extends java.lang.Object
implements DisjointSet
    Provides an implementation of the DisjointSet interface. All operations run in near-constant-time (bounded by the inverse Ackermann function)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OptimalUnionFind(int size)
      Creates a new OptimalUnionFind data structure of the specified size

      Returns the number of distinct sets.

      Returns a representative member of the set that i is part of.
      int size()
      Returns the number of elements.
      void union(int i, int j)
      Unions the two sets specified by i and j.

      • find

        public int find(int i)
        Description copied from interface: DisjointSet
        Returns a representative member of the set that i is part of. This representative member is the same for all members of the same set.
        Specified by:
        find in interface DisjointSet
        Parameters:
        i - specifies the set of which we want to find the representative member
        Returns:
        returns the representative member of the set that i is part of

      • union

        public void union(int i,
                  int j)
        Description copied from interface: DisjointSet
        Unions the two sets specified by i and j. All elements in the sets of i and j will be represented by the same element.
        Specified by:
        union in interface DisjointSet
        Parameters:
        i - member of the first set
        j - member of the second set
